item.title: Robyn add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Robyn add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Read, read, read. Read everything -- trash, classics, good and bad, and see how they do it. Just like a carpenter who works as an apprentice and studies the master. Read! You'll absorb it. Then write. If it's good, you'll find out. If it's not, throw it out of the window." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "So the writer who breeds more words than he needs, is making a chore for the reader who reads." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Robyn add a quote by Colette
item.description:
"Put down everything that comes into your head and then you're a writer. But an author is one who can judge his own stuff's worth, without pity, and destroy most of it."
(<i>Casual Chance</i>, 1964)" -- Colette
